required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The researchers will carry out a randomized experimental study. Participants in the experimental group will receive a treatment based on suboccipital inhibition technique in addition to conventional treatment. Participants in the control group will only receive the conventional treatment. The existence of significant differences in both groups will be analyzed.

detailed_description.textblock: Conventional therapy will consist of microwaves, interference currents, and manual therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analogue Scale for Pain
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately before starting the intervention and after the last session of the intervention, that is, 2 weeks from the start
primary_outcome.description: a continuous scale comprised of a horizontal (HVAS) or vertical (VVAS) line, usually 10 centimeters (100 mm) in length, anchored by 2 verbal descriptors, one for each symptom extreme: "no pain" (score of 0) and "worst imaginable pain" (score of 10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Six-item Headache Impact Text
secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately before starting the intervention and after the last session of the intervention, that is, 2 weeks from the start
secondary_outcome.description: A global measure of adverse headache impact. The final HIT-6 score is obtained from simple summation of the six items and ranges between 36 and 78, with larger scores reflecting greater impact.

arm_group.description: Two groups of patients suffering from tension headache associated with cervicalgia are selected. The control group performs conventional therapy. The experimental group performs conventional therapy plus the technique of suboccipital inhibition
We compared data from both groups

intervention.description: Deep maneuver of myofascial induction in the suboccipital muscles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pathology tension headache associated with cervicalgia
Exclusion Criteria:
- pathology of nervous system
